Great town. I have been to the Amazon rainforest in Peru 4 times but this was my first trip to Cuzco. My only question was why did it take so long. If you like to walk and enjoy history, it is great. Also excellent food and lodging at very reasonable prices.

Good history and most parts very pleasant. Some lovely historical buildings, pleasant squares and friendly people, all at bargain prices. Definitely recommended for a 2 to 4 day stop. However, expect traffic chaos, lots of fumes from knackered old cars (and we noticed no women drivers?!?), hawkers trying to sell you stuff everywhere (hats, trinkets, musical instruments, cigarettes, massages!) and of course getting out of breath very quickly due to the altitude.

Has it All!. Architecture, history, restaurants, discos, shopping, site seeing, open spaces, people watching ... this location has it all. Not to mention parades and marching bands on special occasions. Spend a day easily or stay in one of the several accommodations nearby and spend a few. Use as a home base to explore other parts of the city. Highly recommended.

Nice Center. Very nice area, beautiful historic buildings, many restaurants, bars, coffee shops but very expensive stores, avoid them and go to Avenue El Sol if you are looking for souvenirs, handcrafts, silvery, etc..its probably 25 to 30% less expensive than center.
Lovely Square. This is a beautiful green square with good seating for taking in the view. Many restaurants and cafes with great views of the cathedral and other historical sights in the square.

Beautiful Historical Plaza...but. It was a great people watching space amid the historic buildings. We were there on a beautiful day and wanted to spend some time just sitting on a bench and enjoying the atmosphere. The problem is that you are constantly (at least once or twice a minute) getting approached by locals to purchase their "stuff". Things like jewelry, water color paintings, trinkets, etc. I do admire these people for their initiative and trying to improve their lives but the sales pitches are constant and keep you from relaxing with a little peace and quiet.

Great Location, Great Staff. This hotel is housed in an historical building. You get a good sense of how the wealthy lived in the past. The hallways meander thru steps, turns and open courtyards to get to the back compound. The rooms, not large, are comfortable. The staff is fantastic! The dining room serves wonderful food and the wait staff are friendly and attentive.

A great place to explore Ancient and Modern Culture. So much rich history in the town of Cusco and its historical section. One can only imagine what it looked like before the Spanish came along and detroyed the beautiful Incan Culture. A place worth at least a week to discover everything thing
Good for a 1/2 day!. I wouldn't spend a ton of time but it's good for some time to explore, look around, have lunch/dinner etc. we spent an afternoon and evening and liked it!

Massage?. Lovely city and the plaza is beautiful. Both locals and tourists can enjoy it.Would be nice if, like the rest of the city centre, you could go 40 seconds without a laminated flyer and the words 'Massage?!' being blasted at you. MASSAGE!?

Complete rest: nice attractions, great visits. It was absolutely relaxing :) Minimal begging, even within the shops, great attraction on the man square, nice and charming people... Everything a "get away" has to offer!

The Historical centre of Cusco. This is a great place to hang out, drink some coffee or a Pisco Sour and take in the sights. The day we arrived there was a huge celebration and the day we left as well. Pretty much every weekend something going on here. It was great.

Beautiful must visit town. Capital of the Inca empire, its a charming hilly town with lots of historic sites as well as good food.I stayed close to Plaza de Aramas. I spent 4 days just walking around, visiting the museums, the historic sites like Sacsaywaman and Cristo Blanco, enjoying Pisco sour tastings and even learnt chocolate making at the Choco Museum. Cheap with great options for everyone. Also a great stop for a lot of day trips around Sacred Valley.
If you have an interest in history you must come here.. There is so much to see in the historical district, between the Cathedral and The Sun Temple alone, is worth the trip.

Pretty part of a historical city. The historical center of Cusco is pretty, especially at night. The main square feature a large church, but there are main other unique features in the surrounding area. The area has also developed into tourist trap, but that is difficult to avoid given the role of tourism to the city.

Beautiful Peruvian colonial town. Cusco was the captal of the Inca Empire. The Spanish invaders in the XVI century destroyed most of the original buildings, but impressive stone walls were preserved as foundations for Spanish style buildings in numerous parts of downtown. The main square is large with beautiful gardens, impressive churches, ample sidewalks and nice views of the surrounding mountains. Narrow streets, many of them for pedestrians only take you from there to cozy neighborhoods with distinctive personalities, plenty of shops with a large variety of handcrafts and restaurants for all budgets. You feel safe, but we observed petty drug dealers selling and reported to police.

A mix of history and culture. Walking through the center of Cusco, I was rewarded with an impressive mix of history and culture, including Inca, Colonial Times and the present time. It is a great place to take many beautiful pictures, but it is difficult if you want to make pictures without any tourists on it.

Stunning Colonial Architecture and History. We stayed at the Hotel Jose Antonio Cusco located conveniently near the Cusco Historical Center a short walk up Avenue Sol. I spent more than 6 hours touring this area but easily could have spent days here. There is so much to see and tour. We watched historic native dances at the Centro Qosqo de Arte Nativo, toured the Convento de Santo Domingo del Cusco, the Plaza de Armis, the Museum Choco, and walked around the art gallery area. Fortunately I broke away from the tour group so that I could photograph much more of the area, such as the exceptional Temple and Convent of La Merced. I have included a number of photographs. This area is a photographer's paradise!

Worth a day, even if you're not a city person. We are not really city people and our best Perú memories are in outlying villages and valleys and along the Inca Trail. That said, Cusco is an interesting city with a fascinating history and worth a day to get to know the historical center and market areas.

Unexpected gem!. This reminded us of a European town center. Stunningly beautiful architecture, cathedral, and surroundings. Impressive at night all lit up as well as during the day. Shopping and restaurants abound. It may take a day or two to get used to the altitude. Wander and enjoy!

nice!!!. we were in south america and can i say Cusco is one of my favorite cities, as in brasil wiht marianita or cartagena i love those cities wiht all histoyrcome to south america but you have to spend the time in those cities just your favorite book SOPHIE

Beautiful, cultural city with a lot of excitement!. We love Cusco! What a high energy, health-conscious place with a dash of spirituality. You can spend days just wandering this uniquely South American city. Most things like food and shelter are very reasonless by U.S. Standards.

the center of Cusco. with its charming decor, elaborate churches, dining establisments, shopping opportunities and currency exchanges, the cenetr of Cusco, Plaza De Armes is the place to see and be seen

Hotel was very close.. Hotel was very close to this location, the cultural part was great.
Just becareful crossing the streets.

Touristic and Historic City: "Capital of Machu Picchu". We visited Cusco as part of our Trip to Machu Picchu. Cusco is 3450 meter above sea level. The city is touristic and full of history. It was very nice to walk around to visit the Square de Armaz, Santo Dominggo Church and many other. There are a lot of Tour Agent and money changer. You can book various tour like Machu Picchu, Sacred Valley etc, at a better price. The people are very nice and friendly.
Cusco City. I enjoyed just walking and exploring the city center. The churches were beautiful and there were lots of opportunities for people watching.
City tour. Good place for walk I love the city walk & the people was friendly Historical city, easy access to traditional market.

Cusco is spectacular!. Cusco is a beautiful must see city. Do heed the warnings about the altitude! The impact is dramatic. We took the train from Cusco to Puno which was a phenomenal experience as well to end our journey.

Beautiful architecture and full of history!. Cultural World Heritage Site by UNESCO. When you are there it feels like going back in time. There is so much to see and learn, you need a good pair of shoes to do a lot of walking and going up and down hills in order to explore the city. Staying hydrated and drinking mate de coca will help with any altitude sickness. The Plaza de Armas is the same place that was chosen by the Incas when founding the city of Cusco. A beautiful square to walk , or sit in one of the benches to take a break , relax , take pictures, film, people watch,etc. And to watch the locals go about their daily lives. Visited the Cathedral which is the home of "El Senor de los Temblores" - Patron of Cusco. And the Santo Domingo Church and Monastery which is also called Coricancha. It was the main Inca Temple built in blocks of carved granite and smelted gold.There are many other churches and also San Blas which is an artistic neighborhood with views of Cusco. You need at least four days to be able to see most of the important sites of Cusco. Worth visiting if you are in Peru.
Marvelous place. Centre of Cusco is really nice and marvelous, one of the most beutiful town we seen in Peru, definately worth to stay for 2 or 3 days before going to Machu Picchu or Ausungate.

Cuzco . Central Cuzco is just an amazing place the cathedrals and plaza and the small but delicious restaurants are just amazing. The bummer is you just can't drink the water We even try the local treat called Cuz that is a roasted Guinea pig I guess it was not out thing and we couldn't get pass the idea that we were eaten someone's pet.

Touristy. Very touristy, however quite a lively and fun place. We viewed a military exercise with all their best uniforms and small bands. Also witnessed a group parading with a band and carrying a religious statue through the streets.Lots of fun balconies to enjoy a drink and/or food and do some serious people watching..don't forget Paddy's Irish Bar! Typical Irish bar inside, however only Guinness in a can and Jameson's. I was hoping for more Irish beers!

So much history. The city is amazing. The Temple of the Sun, The Cathedral are gems. We visited cemetery which shock me completely. It was as beautiful as New Orleans Cemetery. San Pedro Market was a lot of fun and a lot to observe.

Outstanding!. We spent two days in Cusco and I could easily have added two more if I had known this city was so unique! Our last morning we wandered down to Plaza de Armas (our accommodation was very close by) while we were waiting for our cab to arrive to take us to the airport. There was a huge celebration going on with marching army regiments (men and women battalions), Peruvians in colorful costumes with all kinds of unusual adornments (stuffed llamas and structures on their backs). The entire plaza was alive with activity! We were so pleased to be able to witness it!
an excellent place for a tourist to be. An excellent place to spend time as a tourist, to see Cathedral, La Compania de Jesus, restaurants, people watching, parades, money exchange, tourist offices.

Very Touristy, but Very Happening. The centre of Cusco is always bustling. With numerous tourists and locals walking around, it is definitely the place to be when getting to know the city. There are also loads of things to do. The cathedral and various other churches and monuments are all located in the centre, and are must-sees in the city. The only downside is that it is a bit too touristy and with loads of people trying to sell you all sorts of things, it can get a bit annoying.
Festivals Galore. Majestic place to visit and savor the history, the architecture, warm people while being clothed by breathtaking beauty of nature.
Beautiful area, very touristy.. Avoid the shops and restaurants on the main square. Only tourists each and shop there. As soon as you go down a side street, you'll see the real gems.

Centro Historico de Cusco. It is a good experience to visit a place that was the centre of Inca Culture. The churches are very rich and imposing; a clear attempt by the Spaniards in extinguishing the Inca culture.

So much going on.... Everytime we passed by this square there was something going on. Great place to just sit and watch people go by and events taking place. Very vibrant place, unmissable in Cusco, on the way to pretty much anything you do. You will pass through here all the time

Beautiful Plaza. We were here on a Sunday evening and the Plaza was crowded with people who were out for the evening. The plaza includes a government building, cathedral, restaurants and bars. It's a great place to relax and people-watch.

Great for People Watching. Our hotel was within easy walking distance of the square and although we spent most of the day walking and touring, we still walked to the square each evening. There is a huge variety of restaurants located around the square and it's very well lit up. Many of the restaurants have a person with menus outside trying to get you to come in. Several offered free dessert or a glass of wine. We always felt completely safe . . . no doubt more so than we would have downtown in the city where we live.

Highlight of Peru. I had heard how charming Cusco was, but did not think about it much as we were so focused on Machu Picchu. It is such an adorable town with great people, fascinating history, and beautiful architecture. Not to mention, good shops and restaurants. We only spent 2 nights but could have easily done 4 with day excursions in the area.

Rip off . You need to pay for everts single church or building you want to visit, plus non of them actually offers anything special or can't see in Latin America it's just Peru that you need to pay in every corner.

A beautiful plaza with lots of restaurants, shopping, and the great cathedral. The plaza is quite lovely, surrounded by the cathedral, shops and quite a few excellent restaurants. It's a good place to sit (near the fountain), relax, and watch the world go by.
Beautiful City Center. A great walk around the city with a beautiful view of the surrounding scenery. Highly recommend to anyone in the area to visit

Awesome city. Beautiful city very vibrate I definitely enjoyed my few days in Cusco! Amazing place at night. While there at night we sae people performing and dancing. It was so cool to experience the culture and beautiful people of cusco. Beware of the little girls selling dolls they will make up stories to get you to buy the dolls. A little girl around maybe 7 years old, who was in a school uniform and carried the dolls in her school bag told me and my friends she was not allowed to go home until she sold all her dolls.....well we bought all the darn dolls! A few minutes later we bump into her again with another book bag full of dolls telling people the same story! That little girl has her selling technique down lol.

Stay in the Centro area.. The city center is nice and has a lot going on. It is worth a day of site seeing. Once you leave the center it is a filthy place with garbage blowing in the streets that are filled with stray dogs. Don't leave the center.

Beautiful but full of pushy people . If you could remove all the pushy vendors selling goods, tours, massages, drugs, etc., it might be possible to enjoy this beautiful town. But alas after about an hour I could not take another person in my face and hid in my hotel. I did take a tour of the most historic sights and that was very worth doing.

One of the most beautiful squares in the world. After much travel in South America, I arrived in Cusco to a city beyond words. As the navel of the Incan empire, it still stands in most of its former majesty. The center of town is just breathtaking. It ranks as my second favorite city behind Barcelona.

Soak up the atmosphere. Sit on a seat near the fountain and watch the crowds - I saw a military parade with goose-stepping soldiers, a union parade with colourful banners and a band. Colonial era buildings with Spanish style balconies, lots of eateries and museums nearby. Streets full of souvenir shops and street vendors. Real silver and fake silver jewellery. Look out for the gold-clad Inca king and the women and kids with alpacas offering photos for tips.

Take a deep breath and enjoy this high elevation city. We had 3 1/2 days in Cusco after 4 days of acclimation in the. Sacred valley and Machu Picchu. We loved this beautiful city. The history, the people, the food, the shopping all a delight. We all chose to take diamox to help with the altitude. This definitely helped us have the energy and the stamina to climb to the top of ruins, walk the city markets and to really enjoy the vibrant city.

Intersting and historical pleasant old colonial city. Although a lot of people just spend one night here on their way to Machu Picchu is worth spending two or three days and visit the historic center. The churches are very nice and you can get a multiple pass ticket that enables you to visit several churches and museums.There are a lot of tourists as one may expect, but it still maintains its flavor.
Relaxed, Spanish influenced plaza. Relaxed, coz no cars allowed and a lot of space, no loud entertainment. Beautiful restored houses and churches surrounded by the Andes. Crispy and clean air.

Nice centre square with nice history. Lots of interesting buildings surround the square. Many are pubs and restaurants as it pretty typical of town squares. The cathedral is really nice and if you can get a guide to explain the history is it really interesting. Almost nothing is in english. Well worth visiting.

Great walking tour around historical Cusco. Many free sites and few museums to visit . Better to arrange the walking tour with a guide or English speaking local. Market place and surrounding shops and restaurants with Peruvian cuisine are nearby and need to be visited without rash. Safe in a day time and a lot of street performers and dancers by the evening.

The best trip ever!. I liked this site a lot because it is for thrill seekers like myself and for people that are eager to learn about these sites. I encourage others to experience this and feel astonished as I was when I first arrived. Arrive early because it can get really crowded when you arrive at noon and you can't see very well in the dark
Well worth a visit. We had a very fine tour of this with our Gate 1 guide .It was truly very interesting. We toured the cathedral and museum .Both well worth a visit
nice town. very nice town , full of restaurants and pubs, nice hotels with incredible views , be prepare for high altitude but you can handle with pills provided in all pharmacy in town
Beautiful architecture with amazing views of the mountains. Historic building with amazing architecture and stunning views of the mountains. Historic information is throughout the building.
Visit. Historic center of Inca Heartland.As the capital of the Incas, Cusco has historical buildings.The Spaniards added Colonial architecture which adds to the beauty.

Busy Square on the weekend. We were lucky to see all kinds of dancers from different villages parading on the plaza. There were bands playing and also a political speaker was there with microphone and speakers. All very interesting on a beautiful day in Cuzco.

Nice Rest Stop. This plaza is very clean and a great place to stop and sit while people watching. The plaza is surrounded with restaurants, shops, and beautiful churches. We enjoyed watching the families and "feeling" the culture while taking a rest stop here.
Lively and interesting. Lots to see and do. Exquisite churches, shopping , good restaurants and coffee shops, people watching, it has it all.
Fun to Walk Around. The historic center has a recommended walking path which provides for some great views of the city and majestic churches along the way. Be prepared to go up and down some hills!
Walk the whole center. the historical center is well maintained, clean and safe. go to discover the outsides of the historical center very authentic with the locals on the markets and in the streets.

Beautiful! Take a tour!. Beautiful historic center with lots of history. Take a tour so you can learn the history of this area; the interaction between Inca and Spanish Colonial architecture is fascinating.
Muy bonito!. Beautiful city center. Especially when compared to the rest of the city.... The plaza the armas is a great spot for good photos!

History with Passion. One of things in Cusco, Peru that is inescapable, is hearing the history of this land and its people...and why would you want to escape it. I am a 3rd year college student and out of all of the history lessons I have received, this may be one of the first times I have listened with so much interest and curiosity to hear more. The people of Cusco capitalize on this history, but they wear their pride for their country on their sleeves. They live, eat and breathe it. Speak of it will passion and share it as if they were there themselves. The art and architecture is marvelous and is definitely a wonder of the world.
What a view. . Get a map from your hotel and walk. Don't pay to see the attractions, they are free to take pics of. Or you can hire a local taxi to take you to places that may be a long walk.

Typical Peruvian atmosphere. The centre of Cusco is quite compact making it easy to walk around. There are lots of churches to visit, but if you visit only one, then go to the cathedral. An enjoyable place just for a stroll with lots of cafes and restaurants.
Nice View. Very friendly people, beatiful view, all are very clean, nice view for take pictures, a lot crafts stores around the city

Tons of things to do. I spend a whole afternoon there drinking some beers with locals, looking for a chees mate and looking to these building, streets and churches that make me remember old San Juan. There are so many things to do there that you don't need to move from that square.
A Historical Treasure. A great place to walk around and enjoy the warm people and to visit an assortment of stores and historical sites.

Wonderful . I have really enjoyed the historical center of Cusco. Many places to sit and just see people passing. Many restaurants and shops, some amazing and famous churches and everywhere friendly people. Of course, they try to sell things, but that is acceptable. I think you easily can spend a day or more in this area. And if the weather is nice, you will even enjoy it more.
Beautiful plaza to people watch.. Great place to wander around the shops, take a tour of the Catedral and hang out. There's always something going on.

Church After Church. The historic center of Cusco is full of churches and museums. Sadly they all cost something to go into. There are some real gems like the La Compania de Jesus and the Museo Inka. Again sadly you cannot take photos inside any of them. Definitely full of history and art and everyone can find something to enjoy there...
Cusco Central Plaza. Very beautiful central plaza of Cusco. Surrounded with elegant shopping and nice places to eat and drink. Plenty of people watching and activity here

A beautiful square full of history!!. We visited this beautiful city before and after our visit to Machu Picchu! I can't express the beauty of this city center. Yes, it's full of history but it also radiates elegance and it gives the visitor a feeling of how great this city and it's history actually is!!
A must!!!. Cusco is one of the best places I ever been, EPUERTO TRAVEL did a awesome job, they are very honest, really organized and friendly!!!
Historic. This is a must see in Cusco. The churches and surrounding area is beautiful. Little shops near by for shopping, cobble stone streets and we felt very safe.

Great street food but beware of pickpockets and scammers. Visited Cusco June 2015Pros:- Street food! As long as you make sure they're cooked in front of you thoroughly. I still dream about those skewers.- Horseback riding excursion: great experience for the priceCons:- lots of street vendors will make up stories to get you to buy their merchandise. You can be polite but must be firm, otherwise they may follow you.Things I wish I knew:- Make sure you have zipper pockets or it's best to just leave valuables (e.g., phone) in hotel if not needed. Anything in a regular pocket can easily be pickpocketed especially in a crowd. They basically walk behind/alongside you, and as soon as they grab your stuff they turn and disappeared in the crowd behind you, and it's very hard to push through the crowd going in the opposite direction (possible accomplices will block the way). Try not to even get into those crowded situations if possible.Overall only 1 day is all you need to explore this city. All the attractions are very average, nothing in particular stood out.

An obvious must see. Surrounded by historical churches in landmarks, with a beautiful statue in the center, this is an obvious must see in Cusco. It is the center of the town, vibrant and full of life. You can find places to eat or drink here. We were lucky enough to visit during a parade and saw a glimpse of Peruvian culture. If you are in town you must stop by, but you should be aware that places like Starbucks and McDonald's are slowly taking over the Square. A beautiful place to visit both during the day and at night.

Delightfully surprising old City centre . It was a real surprise. A wonderful mixture of Peruvian Spanish and Inca architecture. Spend a couple of days acclimatising to the altitude before heading on to Machu Picchu. A city tour and surrounds was well with learning a lot able the Inca & Spanish history,
Gorgeous!. The plaza is sooooo charning~~~I and my husband both love Cusco and this place!! We spent time walk around here.
Most happening place in the city. Lots of restaurants and nice buildings from colonial era. We found it safe late at night too. It is the place to be when in the city
Has everything. Just come, feel and think.A place to visit again an again.Changing all time because people come and go.But don't try to settle here. Locals only like tourists not neighborgs...

Love this Place!. The main square in Cusco is definitely beautiful, historic and enriching. I loved coming here in the morning and caught the mass at the most beautiful church ever, In the afternoon there was a food market and at night there are numerous bars and eateries where you can enjoy a drink and people watching, all while listening to the church bells ring! very romantic. Will be back

Great for First Day in Cusco!. The city center of Cusco is simultaneously bustling with activity but relaxing to explore. Walk along cobblestoned drives that lead to alleys filled with little shops and local stores while experiencing local people and culture. It's great for a first day in Cusco as you get acclimated to the altitude before embarking on some more physically strenuous activities.

Great place to sit. Really enjoyed sitting in the historic centre, people watching and relaxing. Tons of shops and restaurants in the square, as well as the stunning architecture. You can visit the cathedral for a wonderful tour inside. Very interesting area to explore!

Intriguing place. it's the heart of Cusco and walking the streets is the only way to get the feel of the city. There are many shops and churches to visit.Word of advise, cars are quite rude towards pedestrians and some ignore traffic lights, so be careful when crossing streets.
Amazing atmosphere. Stunning architecture, lots of daily life happening right before your eyes. I recommend carrying a map and crossing all streets, every one has something insteresting

If you love history, You will love it.. This was a flash to the past everything is clean and organized. In the morning you will start with sweaters and by mid-day will end taking it off. The structures are very well keep and there is a lot of sites. Shopping is really great but a great tip is too wait and buy the second time. I bought scarf in Cusco and the store had told me it was a real alpaca fur but it end being fake. Listen to the great history of how the summer/winter solstice autumn/spring equinox was so important for the people of Cusco. Your tour guide will help you relive the era of how the spanish came and invaded and how it was the only indiginous civilization that fought back. They also tell you about the length that they had to go when delivering messages.

magical plaza. Enjoyed sitting in plaza people watching and enjoying the sun. There are lots of restaurants in the plaza. The views are lovely. PeruRail has an office there and the people are very helpful. Highly recommend

A well preserved Spanish colonial city with Incas' vestige. If you visit Cusco, you need to walk el Centro Historico, There you will find a Spanish colonial city with the remains of the ancient imperial city.

Beautiful historical centre!. Cusco's center is worth taking the time to explore. There are so many neat shops, good restaurants, nice churches, plazas and places of historical interest. It is also amazing because one can appreciate the combination of Inca and Spanish architecture; it really is a place where two eras meet. This place is living history and I highly recommend visiting here
Cusco. Cusco is a Beautiful place to visit. Hotel Casa Andina, Cusco was close to everything and service was great. In Cusco the food is incredible and people are very friendly! MUST visit Cusco.
Great Old City. A little touristy, but really a cool place. Just have to ignore the people that would like to sell you something (they are not really in your face).
a very interesteing spot. thanks to this spot i could rest a bit looking to others passers by and tourists like me alike...recommendable.
neat. Neat building. A lot of beautiful structures and art, etc. Wonderful history. Sad they won't allow pics

A beautiful part of town. This area is beautiful, clean and well looked after. This is also the home of North American "cuisine" McD's, KFC, Starbucks.The only downside which has been brought up by other reviewers is the large numbers of girls trying to get you to have a massage. Now they all have the same "menu" and the square security / police, just seem to let them get on with it. But a polite "no" does get rid of them. Just sit for a while in the square and breathe in the beauty.

Beautiful City. Wow! This beautiful city left us wanting more. The streets are clean and safe. If you're hungry you have nothing to worry about, there are cafes, restaurants, bar and even juice cafe to enjoy. Places to shop. But if you want to sit down and just take it all in just sit in the center square and just enjoy. This charming colonial center square is filled with both Inca and colonial history.
Magical place. This city is really a miraculous place. A lot of beautiful buildings, great hotels, incredible culinary experieces, interesting market places and so on.

Night photos. It has a lovely architecture and by night the churches have a warm light. Good for photos.
Plaza is sorrounded by handicraft, and jewelry stores and restaurants.

Special Place. I was very impressed with the look and feel of the centre of Cusco and the streets which lead off the Piazza in all directions. Clean, pedestrian friendly in the main. The only thing ruining it was the constant girls asking if you wanted a massage… er no thanks for the 157th time
Clean and safe. Lovely area to walk around - shops galore around the plaza - plenty of restaurants and tourist shops.

love this area. you can find great restaurants, shopping places and all the tours that you can get...great architecture surrounding this area and you can interact with locals and know more about their culture.
we loved this place to meet. we can meet people like us just from other countries walking here at the downtown which is situated in the upper part of town.

Always saturday in Cusco. This typical city is plenty of restaurants And discos. Every single day are open . Culture history and lots of músic . If you want to be fríendly with local people , try writing CUSCO instead of CUZCO. They say Incas do not have Z . It was brought by spaniards.
tourist. Another way to meet with the locals and experiment with your Spanish The [people in Peru make you welcome whether you purchase their wares or not
i wanted always to be here. this place os magnificent by it mixed flair of antique and new, you can feel you are in the 1500s and at the same time that you are in 2016.
One of the "must see" in Peru. One of the "must see" in Peru. After Machu Picchu the most known place in Peru. Take, at least two days to let yourself get lost in the old streets of Cusco.
Strolled the main plaza. Very pretty. Lots of vendors approach you, I was expertly pickpocketed from a zipped pocket so beware.
Beatiful scenery and architecture . Bustling historical center with beautiful architecture and mountain views. Lots of locals trying to sell goods is a bit overwhelming at times.

Safe and beautiful.. At least the tourist capital of Peru is safe, and very tourist ready. The churches, restaurants, tours, money exchange, bars and the people around are all friendly. Lots of stray dogs, but that's just Peru in general. The food is great! But don't eat too much on your first day. Walk slow and eat plenty of chicken soup. Which every place has! Definitely a must go if in Peru.

Best area in Cusco. The Main area for visiting in Cusco. This area has plenty of churches, squares/plazas and tons of restaurants to try. Many inca walls still exist, built on angles for strength. Lots of photo ops. You will also see many women dressed traditionally with a llama asking to take photos, most just want $1 Sol.
Nice but bring your soles!. Beautiful square, but I was quite surprised to see how many of the churches charged an entrance fee, and also prohibited photography. Budget a good $25 for these fees.
A must see if you are in Cusco. Lots of interesting buildings including of course churches. Nice stores and places to eat. Perfect if you just want a nice place to stroll around for a couple of hours
beatiful. have such an amazing atmosphere,full of people from all parts over the world! and incredible churches

So Much To Do!. The historic city center of Cusco offers so much. It's impossible to see and do everything here, but whatever you do, you won't be disappointed. The center offers a number of wonderful restaurants, bars, nightlife, tour operators, and shops. The history of the city is all around!

Lots of ACtivity, good location. This is a great location to people watch, sit and enjoy the atmosphere, and it is surrounded with lots of stores and restaurants, and churches. We were here at Easter time and there was alot going on. Can't walk or play on the grass, but there's plenty of open space here. Also, a couple of the streets are blocked to traffic which makes it even nicer!

Relaxed. Very nice town centre with plenty of restaurants offering a good selection of reasonably priced food plus many other shops. The cathedral and other historic sites are lovely with a blend of Spanish and local styles. Hotels plentiful and good. Nice climate once you acclimatize to the altitude. Drink plenty of coca tea. Be aware of their odd rules with money exchange. Notes that are damaged in the slightest way will be not be accepted at most money changers and if they do it will be at a reduced rate.

Very nice blend of Incan and colonial history.. Very nice buildings, really safe (tons of police officers at all hours). Lots of nice restaurants, but a bit commercial with lots of hawkers trying to sell tours, exchange money, etc.

Once in a lifetime. I really enjoyed this place, the history, the power of he locals, the golden age of the Spaniards and the $10usd 1 hour massages were AMAZING. Love Cusco although I couldn't breathe

Visit - stay Cusco (Peru). The center of Cusco is worthwhile visiting when you are in Cusco.
The cathedrale is very impressive and showing a part of Peru's history.
Also visiting the market place is interesting. Everything is well positioned and relative clean. You can feel / see the real life of the Peruvian people.

This is Cusco - beautiful and well kept center of downtown Cusco. This is the center of Cusco - great views, tranquilo environment, with lots of great restaurants to choose from. Lots of the touters will offer you a free pisco sour if you pick their restaurant. My favorite were the ones with the balconies... it's all about the views. But if you are in Cusco, you'll check this place out. Enough said.
Beautiful Plaza,, fun for people watching!. Great for strolling, we got surprised by a school parade and dances in folkloric costumes when we expected it least!
Beautiful Historic Square. Had great time alone in Cusco. Square has great restuarant, bars, architecture, people to hang out with, as well stunning views! Must visit!

Tourists be WARE! Huge trap with overpriced food.. As a kid, I remember running around this area without a care in the world. Now, there are tons of thieves so be warned. It's unfortunate, because it's such a beautiful, tranquil spot with the beautiful water fountain in the middle. But like Times Square, it's where you'll get trapped with all the expensive restaurants and bars.
Nice place to stroll. It was crowded when we visited. Can take some beautiful pictures at sunset. Many shops and restaurants near that area

Centro Historico. Beautiful square surrounded by colonial buildings and churches. Good shops and restaurants are also on the square. You can also find museums (Museo Inca, Monasterio de Santa Catalina). Tours are offered by people on the streets.
The Inkas Really Killed It. This city is an historical pearl. It is full of beautiful and genuine good vibes all around the city.
Culture everywhere!. Cuzco is a very cultural and amazing town! From the moment I set foot on the Cuzco airport I was amazed. Compared to Lima this city is so much nicer and way more friendly!

Very touristicy exploited city. Cusco is a compulsary stopover in Pery but not my favorite. It was interesting because of the historical value of Cusco, I was aghast with all the vendors perpetually accosting tourist in all the streets, very noisy town, traffic jams all day long. Unfortunately, cannot be avoided on a Peru trip.

Lovely square but hassled by street vendors. There are some bars around the square with balconies which make for a nice 'people watching' break. There are also plenty of seats around the gardens in the centre of the square, but you will be constantly approached by people trying to sell you toys, souvenirs, trips, shoe-shines and the usual scarves/blankets.
Must see in Cuzco. Centrally located in the city center. I highly recommend a guided day tour of the city of Cuzco as there is so much history there!
Plaza de Armas, Cathedral. Big Plaza to hang around with lots of restaurants, shops and places to visit, Girls and Ladies with alpacas for pictures everywhere.
Excellent area. Everything close to Plaza de Armas was well secured. There were police literally every block and very late at nights

The Heart and soul of Colonial and Incan South America. Enjoy a few hours of just wondering around this magnificent plaza which was the capital of the Inka Kingdom and after the conquest became the center of all activity for the Creation of the new Inka Spanish culture. The plaza is surrounded by Inka buildings covered by Spanish churches, cathedral, homes, shops etc. Take any side street and be prepared for more exciting sites

Lots to do and clean. We spent half a day walking around and we took plenty of photos. There are lots of very nice restaurants, cafes and bars. The area is very clean and plenty of benches in the squares. There were too many people trying to push trips to Machu Picchu and other activities. The architecture is very nice.

Great City Center.. Close to restaurants and shops. The locals will try to get you to eat in their restaurant, if you not hungry just tell them no thanks. Before you try to pick up some Spanish it will help you navigate the area and communicate to the locals.

My New Home. My daughter and I spent a wonderful week in this amazing city. We utilized Cusco as a jumping off point for Vinicinca (a must), Machu Picchu and various other sites. The Centro was an amazing place; to rest, shop, eat or just watch.

Walking Round Cuzco. An historical walk around Cuzco is a must! There is so much history, watching the people going about their daily business and beautiful building to be seen. Lots of cafes and shops for curios.
Beautiful main square. Cusco is a beautiful city and great to walk around in. Great architecture in the main square and cute shops all around.
Beautiful location. Great history!. Don't miss this beautiful part of Cusco. So much history and a beautiful setting. Wonderful people in Cusco.

Amazing views. A relaxing afternoon at the Centro Historico de Cusco was just what we needed before catching our flight back to Lima. Peruvian Airlines is typically cancelling flights or late at the Cusco airport, but a good alternative is to go back to Cusco Centro Historico to just relax. I highly recommend doing this, if your flight has been modified.
Lovely. It reminds me other cities in Latin America, each one with its details that make them special. Lots of places to eat, really good food!

Very nice place for a rest. In the heart of old town Cusco, Cento Historico De Cusco is the main plaza of the city. Surrounded by historically significant buildings you can walk around and shop for souvenirs visit the sites or just relax at the high elevation. Their are also plenty of restaurants to enjoy.

Ok.. It's that sort of thing that you have to do, but it's not the most amazing thing in the world. It's nice, but you don't need to save space in your agenda to go there. Nonetheless, it's in the way of everything, so you'll end up passing through it in your way to anywhere.
Breathtaking walk!. By keeping a slow and steady pace it is easy to look around the center of Cusco. This time not as many street sellers which was a bonus
Interesting old churches. The old cathedral was filled with gorgeous sculptures and artifacts, many of them covered with gold.

Amazing have to see for architecture and art. Amazing have to see for art and architecture. Learn about the church congregations facing different directions and depiction on the altars. Area itself is an art museum. Colorful square with lots of activity were a lot of dancers and singing student music groups there when we visited. Shoe shine guys like to suddenly forget all of the English they knew when they first speak to you when you go to pay them. Get price solid. Many restaurants delightful walking and people watching. could spend a week there just to try all of the restaurants. Lots of shops

Touristy. Beautiful view and amazing buildings. Bars and restaurants are all good. We tried to Irish bars in the square....both 2 thumbs up. Only downside is locals trying to sell you everything and anything when walking thru. It got a little annoying. I even had a little girl (age 5?) harass me to buy her finger puppets and when I said no thank she started to cry and have a tantrum.

Lots of character. This is a great tourist city--you get the charm of historic buildings and narrow streets and it is quite safe and clean. Lots of police around, and not as much problem of stray dogs and their waste as some places. The shopping is pretty good, and there are excellent restaurants everywhere. Definitely walk wherever you can--the streets are so narrow and there are so many cars that the traffic is very slow. Plus you would miss seeing little store fronts and narrow alleys if you were in a car. Some areas have a bit of slope, so if you have just arrived, take it easy for the first day or two or you'll really get out of breath. Don't overlook the local markets--we had delicious and very inexpensive breakfasts at San Blas market, for example. Just go where all the backpackers are, and you can get help ordering and finding the places that are safe to eat at.
The best Company !!!. Amazing company. Worth every cent! We did the lares trek and tour guide Julio was so cool and made us laugh constantly. Such a great trip! We love Machu Picchu Peru Tours!

Machu Picchu Peru Tours are the absolute best!!”. I was visiting Peru with my husband for the first time in december 2015 and reached out to multiple travel companies to try and arrange for a few treks during our 12 days there. We found some companies but Machu Picchu Peru Tours was BY FAR the BEST! They were the most responsive, the most professional, the most knowledgeable (I love history) and also the most fun! Julio was incredibly knowledgeable of Peruvian history and politics, charismatic and made our trip unforgettable. if you are looking forward to visiting Peru, not hesitate to contact them !

The centre of Cusco since Incas times. A large beautiful square, rebuilt during 16th century. Always the centre of Cusco. Inca had Goverment buildings and Palaces there. Unfortunately the Spanish demolish the Palaces and some other buildings to make space for the greatest cathedral of south America.Now surrounded also by a large church and buildings mostly offering cafes, food & tourist services.This is a safe and well maintained square which forms the meeting place for all Cusco visitors.

Cathedral amazing. Visited Cusco today cathedral and inca museum great.its a good city to walk around to see sights. We found the local market which is incredible. Also good city to people watch over a coffee
Lots of Historic Buildings. This area is the center of all the historic structures. Churches and convents along with the Plaza.de Armas. You have to visit here in order to say you were in Cusco.

wonderful place. Make sure you get altitude sickness tablets before going here,, its so high up most people suffer the first days,, take a poncho as well and keep it with you at all times,,, give the chocolate museum a miss,,, not much museum but plenty of overpriced yucky chocolate instead

I loved Cusco. Plenty to see in Cusco, easy to walk around and I felt quite safe travelling on my own. They closed the streets around the square at certain times which made it even easier to walk around but caused some traffic chaos.
beautiful. All what I have seen was great. Cusco people are very nice, sweet, and very peaceful. I would like to go back.
Loved it. Great historic plaza. Fun place to wander around during the day and evening. Great food and drinks available at many restaurants overlooking the plaza
A favorite. One can spend days in Cusco wandering in the historic district, enjoying the scenic views, beautiful fountains, flowers, and amiable people who love their city.

Beautiful Traditional Central/South American Square. Centro Historico de Cusco has a number of beautiful churches and museums surrounding a beautiful tree lined square with benches and statues. The mountains surround the centro historico, giving a breath taking natural backdrop. There are a few small pubs and restaurants off of the square too, which while a bit touristica are worth grabbing a pint and sitting on one of the small porches while people watching!

Very Interesting. We had a guide that took us through the Cusco Cathedral! I recommend a guide for learning about the Inca civilization. Classic architecture, colorful people wandering around with costumes typical of years past.
Amazing Plaza. When you visit Cusco everthing is relatively close if you stay by the main square. It's relaxing and peaceful.

The heart of the Inca!. I travel to Peru every year escorting groups. This is one of my favorite site. I could set in the square and watch people for hours. Very safe area and a number of wonderful restaurants nearby. This is a wonderful place to be on a Sunday to watch people going in and out of the Cathedral to worship. Enjoy!!

Love this place!. I adore cusco, some say its a tourist trap but I found it to be a rich tapestry of culture and diversity. The weather was perfect and the shoping , walking adventures and restaurants are just fascinating. There is so much to do I could have spent a month exploring. The ruins San Pedro markets and the textile stores and museums are all must sees. The city has more churches per capita than any place I have been to South America. Great restaurant and its a pisco sours lovers dream.

The heart of Cusco. This square is the center of town so its got the park in the middle surrounded by churches and restaurants. Good clean open space and the main local landmark. You'll definitely pass by here if ur in Cusco. Public celebrations/events should be held here and its a great place to people watchAlso got a few bars and clubs so u'll find urself here at night time too.Have a wander through the alleys that lead onto other sections of the town and perhaps hidden gems of local restaurants...
Beautiful. Cusco is a magical place..You can sit in this plaza and appreciate the beautiful outdoors, the variaty of people and culture.

Cool place. Awesome place for photos and just chilling out.So good to be there when a festival is on as well, except get in early and make sure you hold on to all your stuff incase something gets taken

Worthy a visit to Cusco. Cusco was the last stop on our trip to Peru. Very nice place to visit and wander around their churches, Inka Palaces, Cafés, restaurants and jewels like the Paintings Collection in Hotel Palacio del Inka just right in front of Koricancha.
Stunning both day and night.. Stunning both day and night.This is a central square with churches restaurants and shops all round. At night the lights are great up into the hills.

Full of character. Main square in Cusco which contains many of the major sites of historical and architectural significance. A must do if you are in this city. It's lively and many of the locals (especially the young people at night) seem to come here as well. There are a few touristy merchants trying to hawk wares like shawls and paintings but they are polite and take no for an answer quickly. We felt very safe walking here even at midnight.
Beautiful. Gorgeous buildings with great manicured landscaping. The sights and sounds made this an amazing place.

Beauty in the Andes. Cuzco is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The plazas, the market, and of course the people of this city make it a dream to walk about, sit in a park, shop and dine. It is clean and the weather is wonderful.
Cusco gorgeous!. completely amazing, warmest people, the architecture and the food (lomo saltado), handicrafts easy super. I definitely comeback again.
The most relevant place in Cusco. I really enjoyed that place, so calm and beautiful on a sunny day. You can spend all your aftertoon at discovering a very rich place with lovely historical details.

Colonial Charm and narrow streets.. Simply enchanting. I wondered the streets of old Cusco for hours, you never know what you will find! Crafts, street food, locals singing and dancing, small coffee shops, textile shops, exotic fruits. Old historic Cusco has it all! Please take your time to talk it all and take it all in.
Beautiful. Beautiful colonial and inca cathedral and churches. Worth strolling around looking at the shops and having a coffee.
Cusco. Lovely historical Plaza, many beautiful old buildings and well kept gardens. Just wandering around, new vistas around every corner - magical Peru

Historical, cultural, peaceful. I spent most of one morning sitting in the Plaza and wandering around the center of the city. The sights and sounds said you were having a different cultural experience. The buildings which line the Plaza give you a real sense of the Spanish influence, yet the Peruvian culture pervades the square. The mountains in the distance say you are in the Andes. The crowds of people seem unhurried, relaxed, enjoying life in an beautiful setting. As I sat on the one of the many benches in the Plaza del Armas, I felt truly relaxed, completely safe, and wishing I could come back for a third visit soon.

City focal point. It was easy to visit this area multiple time to tour churches, select from a huge variety of restaurants, shop or just watch the local or international world go by. Cusco is a huge city but this smaller area is a city unto itself.

Beautiful city in the high mountains. I stayed here for 3 nights but would happily have stayed longer. There's a buzz to this city but also a sense of serenity. It's a world apart from Lima. The people are much more simple and humble and the air is clean. There's a bit of everything from markets, museums, churches and convents full of history to great bars and restaurants. It's a real gem of a place!

Great Historical City Protected by UNESCO. My wife and I visited Cusco on the way to Machu Picchu. The city is quaint and the people are nice. You feel safe walking around. We took a half day city tour which gave a good overview of the history. Recommend visiting if you are on the way to Machu Picchu.
Lovely city. We can certainly recommend a visit to Cuzco city.It was nice to be able to walk round the town and we also had a guided tour.The cathedral is amazing
Simply magical. So much to see and do. Spend at least 3 days here, so that you can take your time to visit the cultural sights, browse the shops, and just sit in a cafe and take in the atmosphere.

Now you have arrived in Peru. . Upon arrival to Cusco Centro, you feel you are now in Peru. The local dress and buzzing of daily life is layered atop the western tourist vibe. It's simply lovely to stop and get a coffee here and plan your days in the town and surrounds. The locals within the town itself seems to benefiting from tourism -- unlike some other towns I've visited. Buy something small to take home.
Lovely square to wander around. Nice square with gardens and pretty balconied buildings around. The cathedral on one side definitely worth a visit. Many places around here for a drink or a meal.
Favourite City in Peru. Beautiful square, lots of things to do and see right there, and lots of good spots to eat. It was a great place to relax and people watch

beautiful city. I went there July 2015.There are so many stores such as restaurants , Travel agency .It was not dangerous.It is famous for travel.It is close to sacred valley, salineras, moray , Urubamba.So many world travelers come there to go Macchu picchu !!!

the Inka city. The historical centre of Cuzco is really where you get an image of what you expect from Peru (missing from Lima). You see the typical peruvian people wearing traditional costumes. Also the cathedral is there as well as many other historical monuments. In addition there is a great market for souvenirs and many traditional restaurants around.
Beautiful!. A beautiful plaza. A great place for people and dog watching. The family dogs run the streets all day playing with each other. They go home when owners come home from work. Restaurants!
Church tour. Walked in while the choir was singing very beautiful church. The atmosphere was electric. Ended up staying for a while great visit.
Beautiful. There is always something going on here. Having a beer or a coffee from one of the many surrounding balconies and watching the people in the plaza is a great way to spend an afternoon

The centre of Cusco. Here is where it all happens. The main Cathedral is here and the Compania de Jesus church plus many restaurants, shops and hotels. This place is full of live all the time and most celebrations are held here. This square looks good and feels good. Love this place.

What a great people-oriented square. It's the tourism centre of Cusco, and it hums at all times. Love the groups of dancers in the evening - not just a tourist spectacle. Anchored by the impressive Catedral, it is ringed by restaurants (including Starbucks, KFC and McD if you really want them).

Take a look and be happy!. Nice place. People are friendly in Cuzco. Buy a 'antichucho" (chicken or beef on a stick) for 5 soles and walk!! I will recommend you a bar where you can dance and have good drinks with latin music and the best party in Cuzco. The name is Bambo is on the Plateros steet. Go there after 11pm they have at taht time live music, and be ready for dance all night!!!!!!!!

Ticketing problems spoil the show. The government has a silly ticketing strategy for the good local historical sites and museums. Basically its either USD 25 each for a day or USD 45 each for a 10 day pass. Most people are passing through for Machu Picchu and only want to take in one thing one day and may be one or two another day so neither works. Enough to moaning , what we saw was great but we walked away from some as we were just keen on a stroll through and that was not an option.

Clean, animated, city centre full of character and beautiful colonial architecture. Loved the Centro Historico de Cusco. It's a very relaxed place with lots of oportunity to sit and watch the world go by. Try Le Papillon in the corner next to the Cathedral that offers seating overlooking the square (Plaza das Armas) with great cocktails. Problem is that once you get outside the 1.5 square kilometre area, Cusco becomes another poor, third world city with all of its problems. Tourism masks this reality and that's sad. But you can enjoy the centre and take advantage of good restaurants, cafes, bars and museums.

Lovely place. The world comes to Cusco. How a place as beautiful as Cusco exists where it is located is a wonder. It's a lovely mix of a city and lots of places to sightsee. It's a great place to hangout and hasn't lost its charm by becoming too touristy

That's Cusco!. There is no way of visiting Cusco and not visiting Centro Historico! That place is the soul of the city. You can quickly notice the Spanish influence in the building and in the surroundings. When I was there they were celebrating a local party "Nossa Senhora de Los Temblores" so the whole place was decorated and local people were very well dressed!

Centre of the Inca Empire. That has been built over by Catholic Churches, creating a very interesting hybrid architecture of Spanish Colonial built on high Incan foundations! This is a center of life - restaurants, attractions and we took up the offer of a massage - up squeeky old stairs into a low-Celine's room, but the best massages we ever had!

Beautiful and popular . Very beautiful and historic little square with numerous restaurants and a large garden area with trees an seating. Very popular spot with the locals and a lovely place to sit and admire the scenery.

Historical, Beautiful Plaza. The historic centre of Cusco is just that... historical. The architecture echoes that of the Incas and Spaniards. Everything is steeped in history, and you need to read up on Inca and Peruvian history to truly appreciate Cusco and the plaza. Definitely a place not to be missed, as it's the centre of the city, and offers great views and restaurants nearby!

I miss Qosqo. The place is wonderful, the streets, the walls, the sky everything have this epic feeling, the magic of the mountain and the history in every step in the walking.Many Museums, many historical places to visit, shopping, restaurants, etc; the bohemia and history in one place.I loved to meet people on the Plaza de Armas, go for a tour or a place to pass the time, I really miss Cusco, hope to be there sooner than later.

Absolute fav part of Cusco. By far the best part of Cusco, for people watching, architecture, immersing yourself in culture, and admiring the stray pups. Actually spent an evening with a bottle of wine parked on a bench here for a bit and just observed!

Great highlight of Peru!. The plaza de Armas of Cusco is one of the best in the country you can go back in time to colonial Cusco and see Inca foundations at the base of each main building the churches were built on top of the Inca Palaces in an atempt to errase the Inca culture.The main plaza has changed several times due to earthquakes and some questionable governmental decisions. But in general its a very livid and beautiful place.
Beautiful Main Square. Nice city to walk around in the evening. The churches are lit up and the restaurants serve great food.
nice view. people were very nice and the place is very well preserved as well as the food there is very nice recommended

So peaceful!. It's a big area with a square in the middle. There're so many restaurants, cafes and bars nearby, most of these places have balconies overlooking the square. For me Cathedral of Cusco was the main attraction in that area. It's so relaxing and peaceful sit around this area and have a drink or a coffee.

Great for New Year's Eve!. The square is very pretty, with great restaurants at its sides, flowers, buildings, basilica, everything perfect. In New Year's Eve it was awesome, full of people, music, fireworks everywhere, bars opened, etc.

New years day here and a few days before. I loved this city - stunning and full of character. We stayed at the ramada and it was great. We ate coy in the center too and palto sandwiches from the street. Everything was excellent. Funnily though buy your alpaca scarfs here you can bargain better elsewhere it becomes a bit harder

Introducing Cusco. to most this is probably your first sight. Plenty to see and wander about. There are lots of hawkers as well. don't get annoyed with them its their means of life and getting annoyed only ruins your day. take in the atmosphere and enjoy Cusco.
nice plaza. very nice plaza de armas wonder full houses at the top highly recommend to spend time here , safe y beatiful place

One of my favourite cities. This is a really beautiful and interesting city bringing together so many different eras and cultures. The history and buildings are interesting with some lovely churches, the food is great with lots of diverse options and there are lots of small markets and some lovely artistic shops plus high quality jewellery and alpaca clothing shops. There are great hotels and overall it feels safe and welcoming. 2 to 3 nights at a minimum to get a feel for the place and enjoy some great experiences.
The central plaza. This plaza area and surrounding museums and churches hold much Inca, Quechua, Spanish and Catholic history and artifacts

Nice plaza. Originally the main plaza of the Inca empire. Sadly, the Spanish destroyed most of the original Inca buildings, replacing them with the typical Spanish churches and administrative buildings. It is a nice plaza with trees, families enjoying the open spaces, and tourists everywhere. Some of the original Inca foundations remain, but the glory of the Incas is lost and replaced with a Spanish plaza that could be anywhere in the world.
Full of History. Many places to spend time, learn or relax. Sadly there is a Kentucky Fried, McDonalds and Starbucks in prime locations.

new year celebration. we spent new year celebration at Inca Grill restaurant which is at the plaza, great dinner and fine music and at midnight we enjoy the fireworks and they said that the tradition is that you have to run three laps around de plaza, we prefer to have there drinks at the restaurant jejeje

One the most welcome historical city. Hard to explain so many pleasant points. We are from Brazil and we did not see any delinquency or violence ambiance, in the historical part, we visited. It remember, sometime, Thailand.Local people are vigilant to gives the best of their city, but in business NEVER buy in the first shop. Always compare quality and price.Food are excellent and many good museum.

Happening place. Great place to get history, eat, shop people watch locals and tourist, take pics, hold baby lambs. There were so many opportunities for pics. Lots of colorfully dressed children with baby lambs that you could take pics with. Don't forget to give them some coins. I would bring a longer lens for candies of the locals. If they know you r taking a pic of them they want money lol.
Interesting and historic. We enjoyed walking around the historic city center. Would highly recommend the many little markets. We enjoyed checking out the various stands and products. H
Beautiful Cusco. This is the best Plaza de Armas in Peru. The buildings and cathedrals make this a must see if you're in Cusco.
Beautiful historic architecture. Lovely historic district with ornate Spanish Churches, remains if Inka Temples & narrow meandering streets alive with shops, markets, museums & restaurants.
History may change. I first visited during the shining path era,some 25 years ago.The place has not changed at all, but the crowds got bigger....
beautiful old city full of charm with amazing cathedral. Amazing cathedral with very unique paiting and decorations. A little to much suvenirs all around but still beautiful

Wonders of architecture!. Cusco definitely requires 2 days on the city itself at very least. There are a lot of archaeological sites around, but you must plan a visit the centre of the city, Cathedral, streets and markets and of course the 12-angle stone.

Big plaza, def a must see!. Cusco was much more Beautiful that we thought! The center of Cusco is beautiful colonial and filled with life. We really loved the stairs at the Cathedral, where many locals and turist sat down for a while enjoying the sun... although august was cold, we had lots of sun and we bought the most lovely alpaca "ponchos". Great to see all the gringos walking with their ponchos! Do not leave the city without tasting the tamales!

welcoming city. All people from Cusco are very welcoming and make you feel at home. I was impressed with the education of people in this city. Speaking of people, they are beautiful. Yes they are good-looking. In the main square there are several restaurants oferencendo typical food at a reasonable price. Taxi is cheap and can be used by those who do not want to use bus.
Lovely heritage site. The center of Cusco is charming and photogenic. You could spend 2 days just wandering around, shopping, and taking photos. Try to stay at a place in the center if you can!

Amazing historic centre of Cusco. Cusco is a UNESCO World Heritage site and is one of the world's great archaeological centres. The historic heart of the city is awe-inspiring, consisting of spectacular colonial buildings standing next to huge Incan ruins. It is an amazing fusion of New World and Old, and although there is a profusion of tourists, the city retains a great sense of authenticity thanks to the excellent way it is maintained and policed and the sheer scale of the architecture. We saw some spectacular sunsets from the city centre. Note that during the day, it can get hot and with all the walking you might do, be sure to take plenty of water.
this is a place to go. I would stay for hours getting lost in Cusco downtown, I always liked to go around by the cities I visit, so Cusco is easy to know by foot, I really liked it
Great Place to visit. A beautiful public space which is well cared for and where the town, local and tourist, seem to meet.
Acclimating in Cusco. We arrived on Dec. 24 th before our trek on Dec. 27th. Cusco is an amazing place to acclimate for a couple of days before the trek. So much history.
Good for short walk. Just like Plaza in Eroup, it has pretty much the same atmosphere. You can walk around the Plaza and enjoy some attractions like 12 angled stone.

Plazas of Cusco. There are two centrally located plazas - blocks from eachother. A lovely, walkable city with restaurants, alpaca apparel stores, chocolate shops and a chocolate museum. Local souvenirs. Cathedral. Definitely a city worth visiting.

Massive New Year's Eve celebration!!. The central square of Cusco is surrounded by beautiful colonial style buildings, but I have to say, it's not going to be a main event of your day. But, we were fortunate enough to have experienced the famous New Year's Eve celebration in Cusco and this central square is the epicenter of the craziness!I hear everyone from outside of Cusco travels to Cusco for the NYE and sure enough, there were so many people out partying at the square. Everyone is wearing something yellow (I was told that yellow symbolize "Re-birth". so it's a tradition to wear yellow underwear), sharing drinks BYOB style outside and popping fire works everywhere. And the main event of the night is off course the count down; once the clock hit midnight, everyone at the square start running around the square 12 times. It's such a fun thing to watch (bummer, I didn't get to participate in the running as we were still having dinner, but you should definitely join in!) and definitely the best NYE celebration I've ever seen!
this is where all started. the historic centre of Cusco is a very interesting place and is protected by the UNESCO. I will advice everyone who wants to know an antique living city to come to Cusco.

One of my favorite squares at night. small but compact square bounded by two magnificent churches and some shops. Lot of cute walking ways-beware of the crazy divers for sure. If you have small kids watch out also.

You will end up here one way or another!. This is where you should go first to start knowing Cusco, prices here are a bit higher compare with the rest of the city, but is the center of the city and the historical sites, where most people get together and where the party is at on New Year

An architectural joy. Cusco is one of the most beautiful cities, and while most people focus on darting out to Machu Picchu (which you should), they forget to give Cusco the time it deserves. So make sure you have at the very minimum 2 days to just enjoy Cusco. The city is beautiful, with an architecture that includes an Inca stone base and Colonial tops. Its cobbled-stoned narrow streets are a delight to walk and take pictures. Lots of little stores with many things to buy, from alpaca sweaters, to jewelry, to a variety of artifacts. It has become a place where people just gather, walk, even at night it is alive. I've been there three times, and I can't get enough of it.

Plaza de Armas. This is a beauty itself and its surrounded by some churches. Once this plaza was marked as the exact centre of the Inca Empire. No trip to Cuzco would be complete without a visit to Plaza de Armas. It's a peaceful place to admire, take pictures of the fountain, visit the churches and much more. Very relax atmosphere; with many restaurants around to choose from depending on the cuisine you are after but peruvian food its well known around the world thats is delightful to try if you haven't done it before or if you have to keep eating great food.
Amazing !. This place is mágical! You gotta taste the "emolientes". Because of the height digestión slows down, this emoliente is a tea that helps you accelerate digestion. Let me tell you it works!!
Beautiful place. its the centre of cusco where there is lot of shops and garden at the centre where you can sit during the night. the places if perfectly lit with the lights which is so beautiful.

The best Peruvian square. It's a excellent square and everybody should try to spend here the eve of new year... the celebration is spectacular and if you need good lucky for the new year, you can't forget to walk around the square in the happy new year's celebration...

Centro movimentato . Bel centro città, forse il più bello e moderno del Perù. Però anche in questo caso se dovessero adattarsi alo stile europeo con più aree pedonali sarebbe un gran beneficio per la città e per i turisti.Beautiful old city, perhaps the most beautiful and modern Peru. But even in this case if they had to adapt alo European style with more pedestrian areas it would be a great benefit for the city and for tourists.

The heart of the city. The Centro Historico de Cusco is the heart of this lovely city. The plaza is surrounded by several stunning churches and some other interesting buildings and restaurants. We found that there are many celebrations in Cusco and we happened to be there during some type summer celebrations. Each day there was a parade through the plaza and parties at night. It was fun to see the colorful clothing from each of the different regions and many of the groups had impromptu dances.
Lively place. Shop on streets away from the city center for better prices on local artifacts and woolens. Great art shops to explore.

Beautiful centre. Although this is the main town for Machuu Picchu it is amazing place to visit. This a lot to do and see. Lovely shops and restaurants. I could have sat in the main square and watched the world for hours!

Good place to explore. We came here for dinner on our first night in Cusco, (Limo). We thought the this center square was cool and came back the next day to explore. It has lot's of little shops and restaurants. Worth a visit.

A place for happenings. I found this place amazing, specially to find local people and learn from them, also finding new gringos when one is travelling alone, so you can never NEVER feel you are completely lonely when traveling ALONE.I suggest you convert this place as a meeting point, also you always will find happening some kind of fiesta when you come in anytime, peruvians are so joyous and happy people.
You would think you're in a mountain town in spain. Such a quant and beautiful place nestled in the the Andes, it seems so like Europe, but with an Incan flare.
We loved it. Very clean, organized... You have to check the schedule for visitors in advance. It is full of historic places. Restaurants, travel and tour agencies. A city for tourists.
Fascinating place, perfect for exploring on foot. Perfect for strolling around. Lots of restaurants and things to do. Don't miss the Chocolate Museum if you are travelling with children in tow.
Worth discovering.. This was very interesting to walk around. You will find that you have to take your time due to the altitude. The market is rather fascinating to see.

two histories collide. Spanish colonial city build on the ruins of the inca empire, Cusco is an amazing city that is hard not to fall in love with. It is a place of magic and I love it overtime I am there.

Cusco, the Rome of America. Amazing square with an incredible environment. It is a place that you will go everyday in your visit to Cusco. You will enjoy the architecture and the historic places around.
Beautiful place!. Plaza de Armas and around, great places to visit! We spent New Years Eve and it was absolutely amazing. Solo or with friends this lovely city will take your breath away!

History at your finger tips. History fo Peru is at your fingertips when you visit the historic center. This locale has more than just the churches, but the people, the atmosphere, the energy of a place that has been a population center for thousands of years. Walk around the historic area, ramble down the streets shooting off into all directions.This area is the best place to immerse yourself in the City that is Cusco.

Stunningly beautiful, lots of nice restaurants and shops. I was apprehensive about visiting Cusco because I had heard that it was overly touristy but although there are certainly a collection of industries serving the tourist infrastructure, I didn't find that it distracted overly from the architecture, the history, the people and the sense of place. I had so much fun wandering around the city and looking at stonework, wearing, etc. or sitting in the park and people watching. Can't wait to return and explore the surrounding area some more.

Cusco ... Inca paradise. Cusco is definitely a must visit for anyone who wants to tour South America.It's such an ancient city with amazing cultural influences that are still present in modern times. The architecture is incredible considering what the spanish thought of these wonderful indigenous people.There is too much to see but definitely you must visit a famous church, Machu Picchu and the old square in Cusco.I highly recommend this for adults and families as well.

Architecture and history impressive. Three Basilica / Churches in one visit. Very ornate and a lot of history surrounds this area. Well worth a visit but get a guide to tell you the story as it is really interesting the way different cultures portray the same religion in art.

Lives up to the hype. I had heard a lot about Cusco but it lived up to the hype. It is beautiful and friendly. No doubt geared towards tourists going on to Macchu Picchu but a tourist destination in its own right the city has amazing colonial buildings on top of the Inca Ruins. Impressive.

a good place to get a little sunburn. when I returned back from my tours here in Cusco, I always liked to sit down a the central fountain in the plaza and get my little sun tan because people say I am too palid...
Amazing!!!. This is a great place to visit with tons of options for restaurants, bars and clubs.It is also very safe 24/7 .... 100% comfortable to walk with your belongings at any time
Plaza de Armas. Great place to wind away the day in one of the many great bars with great happy hours. Make sure to park your bum on a balcony seat and enjoy!
Great city center. Even though you can't help it to wish there were some Inca's buildings left, the center is very pleasant. You can simply wonder through the streets forever.

Appears to be the place to see local parades!. Always something going on with local parades, religious processions, demonstrations. Been there 4 times and still have not found a good place to eat on the Plaza. Much better food in local places on side streets.

Super cool. The plaza de armas is a great place to hang around and people watch while you enjoy the historical buildings. It can be a bit busy and loud depending on the time of year and what's happening.
As good as a plaza can be . With beautiful architecture, many things to do close by and little traffic. It's also safe (common big city precautions apply).

Very pleasant historic center. Very historic area. Streets are generally well paced and cobbled and traffic is quite orderly. The central foci is of course the plaza armas. However, do note that as you walk away from the Plaza Armas area, the places become very dodgy - just do not walk more than 500 meters away from the plaza as the area becomes rougher and not tourist friendly not safe. Not recommended to walk at night.

Interesting and bustling. Central Cusco is an amazing mixture of Incan and Spanish buildings. The area is easily accessible on foot. There are several churches and amazing museums in the immediate area. Good restaurants not too expensive around the Plaza de Armas. Try and make time to visit the fascinating central market with its busy indoor stalls.
Loved the Architecture. Cusco is just beautiful, with the Andes on all sides. The take off and landing is a bit nail biting. It is worth spending time and appreciating this lovely town
